ai.summary: A 7.7 km moderate coastal ridge hike in the UK from Cauldhame to Burra Bridge, offering sea views, varied terrain, and a steady pace suitable for hikers comfortable with exposed coastal paths.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows coastal ridges with mixed surfaces: grassy tracks, compacted earth, and occasional rocky steps. Expect uneven footing, exposed sections with sea views, and some narrow, side-cutting paths along the coast.
ai.safety_notes: Check tides and weather before you go; stay on marked paths and away from cliff edges; wear sturdy waterproof footwear with good grip; UK coastal weather can change quickly, so bring layers and a waterproof shell; carry a map and compass or GPS, plus a charged phone (but be aware of possible poor signal); carry enough water and snacks; inform someone of your plan and estimated return time; in an emergency call 999 and ask for coastguard if near the water.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Head torch (for low light or emergencies)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) generally offers milder weather and good visibility; winter hikes are possible with proper gear and daylight planning.

seo.title: Cauldhame to Burra Bridge Coastal Hike – 7.7 km Moderate Coastal Ridge Walk
seo.meta_description: Discover the 7.7 km Cauldhame to Burra Bridge Coastal hike in the UK. A moderate coastal ridge trail with sea views, varied terrain, and practical safety and gear tips.
